title: Bridgman 2016 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: There's no mistaking the variety, with its aromas of honeysuckle, ripe peach and jasmine. It drinks off dry, with easy-drinking stone-fruit flavors that drop off a bit on the back half.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Roureda Llicorella Poboleda Vi de Vila Pedro Ximénez (Priorat)
description: Muddled aromas are more funky than fruity or fun. In the mouth, this varietal Pedro Ximénez feels bright, but with an oily texture. Salty apricot and peach flavors are in the Sherry zone, while this fades quickly and tastes like salted nuts on the finish.
designation: Roureda Llicorella Poboleda Vi de Vila

title: Château de Brigue 2017 Villa Brigue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A classic blend of Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah, this easy, fruity wine is softly textured, with a hint of caramel as well as raspberry flavors. Touched by pepper and deliciously fresh, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Château de Saint-Martin 2017 Colette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Named after the author Colette who frequently came to Provence, this wine is full of attractive red fruits and crisp acidity. It has a tight, bright edge that makes it extra refreshing. Drink now.

title: Château Le Bonalguet 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine is intense with pear flavors that gives it a delicious, ripe character. Add in the pepper, spice and acidity, and the wine is balanced, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Château Maïme 2017 Instant Maïme Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The light color is repeated in the light texture of this wine. Delicate red-currant and spice flavors are lifted by bright acidity. This wine, peppery from the 60% Grenache in the blend, is ready to drink.

title: Château Reynon 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Taut and crisp, this is a lively, bright wine with intense acidity and a tangy, mineral texture that accompanies layers of pear, lemon and gooseberry. Drink now.

title: Coli 2014 Riserva  (Chianti)
description: Aromas suggesting moist soil, vanilla and black plums lead the nose of this wine. The straightforward palate offers prune, clove and licorice touches alongside round tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Dianella 2016  Chianti
description: Made from Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this recalls baking spice, dark fruit and tilled soil on the nose. The straightforward palate offers black plum, cinnamon and white pepper notes alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Carneros 2015 The Famous Gate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From an estate-grown, single site, this wine is warming and tangy, as well as soft and simple. It is also varietal in its offering of rhubarb and cranberry.

title: Domaine des Diables 2017 Les Petits Diables Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault provide a satisfying blend of crisp red fruits for this juicy wine that's refreshingly packed with intense acidity. It's a wine to drink now, great as an aperitif.

title: Domaine des Mapliers 2017 Mapliers Préferences Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With its alcohol this is more of a rosé for food than for aperitif. It is rich, soft and smooth with caramel and rich strawberry flavors. The wine is fat, full in the mouth. Drink now.

title: Duca di Saragnano 2016 Governo all'Uso Toscano  (Chianti)
description: Scorched earth, truffle and dark-skinned fruit aromas emerge on the nose of this wine. The straightforward palate delivers black currant, cedar and vanilla flavors alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Fattoria Uccelliera 2015  Chianti
description: This blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Canaiolo opens with subtle dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and underbrush aromas. The juicy palate offers dark berry and star anise flavors alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

title: Gruber Röschitz 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: Notes of yellow pear have a touch of juicy ripeness on the nose. The palate adds an earthy element but also lots of freshness. The finish is clean and dry.

title: Highland Valley 2015 Zinfandel (San Diego County)
description: Plummy aromas meet with thyme and sage on the juicy nose of this bottling from a vineyard near San Diego. It's a bit thin and taut on the sip, with flavors of black tea, boysenberry, pepper and herbs.

title: Il Palagione 2016 Ori Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Toasted oak, eucalyptus and coconut aromas come together in this. The firm palate offers bitter almond, oak and yellow apple skin flavors. Sage and saline notes close the rather lean finish.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Resolute Estate Red (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Smooth, rather soft and very fruity, this mouthfilling wine offers deep blackberry flavors and a sweetish aspect that smooths over any tannins in the texture.

title: Jade Cove 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: While this wine starts with an oniony aroma, it blows off fairly quickly, displaying aromas of honey, peach, guava, lemon and dried herbs taking its place. The palate shows a whisper of sweetness, balanced by tropical fruit flavors and a herbal finish.

title: Jessie's Grove 2013 Fancy Quest Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Smooth and mellow, this wine has softly spicy, earthy aromas and ripe mature fruit flavors that pick up a maple syrup note on the finish. The tannins are very light and the texture is very smooth considering the high alcohol level.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Unoaked Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Bright aromas of ripe pineapple and papaya carry this exuberant unoaked Chardonnay. While light in frame, the palate packs a burst of tropical fruit flavors cut through with lemon and tonic clarity.

title: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Sauvignon Blanc (New York)
description: Pleasantly tropical in tones of pineapple rind, citrus and banana, this is a well-balanced offering that begs to be enjoyed seaside. There's a pleasing roundness to the light-bodied palate, with a refreshing sweet-tart finish.

title: Lovingston 2016 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)
description: This Merlot is superfloral and bright, with aromas and flavors of kirsch, red cherry, violet, lavender and cinnamon that carry to the palate. The finish is long and flavorful.

title: Maddalena 2017 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Candied raspberry, cranberry, orange juice and bubblegum combine for an inviting nose on this bottling. It lands on the palate somewhat flat at first, but then more intense acid and structure creep in, and it's quite zippy by the finish.

title: Maryhill 2016 Proprietor's Reserve McKinley Springs Vineyard Roussanne (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Examples of this variety are a relative rarity in the state. Aromas of cinnamon, herb and pear lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors with slightly bitter finish.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2013 Coma Blanca White (Priorat)
description: Oxidized aromas of waxy white fruits lack freshness and suggest murk and age. While this blend of Garnacha Blanca and Macabeo is holding onto its solid mouthfeel, it tastes mostly of old wood and spiced melon. On the finish, notes of raw wood and buttered popcorn are out front.

title: Melini 2016 San Lorenzo  (Chianti)
description: This wine's subdued red plum and underbrush aromas emerge in the glass. The simple palate delivers red cherry, vanilla and clove flavors alongside supple tannins.

title: Messina Hof 2017 Sophia Marie Bright Beginnings Rosé (Texas)
description: Bright coral pink in the glass, aromas of raspberry, cherry and kiwi skins are sprinkled with white pepper and celery. Made from Dolcetto, the palate shows measured acidity balanced by lush flavors of strawberry, raspberry, kiwi and guava that remain juicy through the  finish.

title: Montirius 2017 La Muse Papilles Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: While a bit closed and smoky upon opening, this wine reveals fresh peach, raspberry and strawberry hints after some aeration. Vinified with ambient yeasts, it's a full-bodied dry rosé offering equal parts savory herb and mineral intensity and delicate apple and pear fruit. Fresh acidity makes for a brisk finish.

title: Panizzi 2014 Vigna Santa Margherita  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This opens with oak, butterscotch and citrus peel aromas, with a whiff of resin. On the rather lean palate, fresh acidity supports toast, coconut and dried apricot flavors. It shows elegance but lacks the fruit richness to stand up to the oak.
